bibl.title: Greek or Egyptian? The Origin of the Ptolemaic Title συγγενής.
Archiv für Papyrusforschung und verwandte Gebiete

bibl.note: The origin of the Ptolemaic honorific court title συγγενής is examined on the basis of Greek, Demotic and hieroglyphic sources (the largest body of source material is formed by the inscriptions [Greek, Demotic and hieroglyphic] of Ptolemaios and his father, Panas son of Psenobastis). It is shown that this title cannot be derived from any pharaonic Egyptian title and that, in fact, it found its way into both Demotic and hieroglyphic usages. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Csaba A. Láda, Greek or Egyptian? The Origin of the Ptolemaic Title συγγενής.

The origin of the Ptolemaic honorific court title συγγενής is examined on the basis of Greek, Demotic and hieroglyphic sources (the largest body of source material is formed by the inscriptions [Greek, Demotic and hieroglyphic] of Ptolemaios and his father, Panas son of Psenobastis). It is shown that this title cannot be derived from any pharaonic Egyptian title and that, in fact, it found its way into both Demotic and hieroglyphic usages. - Avec résumé en anglais.
